Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Is that possible to mix vue template and JSX" (#6862) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Create vue template is fixed and it can only using some switch or if to exclude what I don't want to display. I am thinking using JSX inside the vue template to make the vue template more flexible to for other developer to code. In this case, I can pass the JSX as data to the component base to display what I want. 

For example I have 3 file.

A, Call the template base.

B, Base template for display.

C, template for display on the base template.

In this case, A will import B and C, A pass C to B by using prop. 
This syntax, will make B do not need to import all the file and not much coding I need to deal with.
C will contain all of the coding for display. B is a place to load all coding.

### What does the proposed API look like?
.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "scroll.js: replaceState() is not supported in IE9" (#1834) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### What is actually happening?
IE9 throw the following error: `Object doesn't support this property or method "replaceState"`.
This was introduced here:
commit: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/commit/c166822cdc6cadd9f3c01085b877c86d74362b95
related issue: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/1585

Opened issue "If a Promise.all contains multiple asynchronous commits, the logger will only pick up the first one.  " (#1008) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/lmjzzn18q](https://codesandbox.io/s/lmjzzn18q)

### Steps to reproduce
Apologies. I'm working on proprietary code, so I can't copy/paste the error. This is an error with Vue-logger. 

I have an action called "updateQueue" which returns Promise.all([
  asyncAPICall().then(data => commit(types.FOO, data)),
  anotherAsyncAPICall().then(data => commit(types.BAR, data))
])

In this case, commit(types.FOO) shows up in the log, but commit(types.BAR) does not.  

I've tried to reproduce in the fiddle and cannot, probably because the actual API call uses axios.interceptors.request.use to make additional logs? 

### What is expected?
I expect both Commit(types.FOO) and commit(types.BAR) to show up in the console log.

### What is actually happening?
Only commit(types.FOO) is logged. 

---
Sorry I can't give you the actual code.  When I'm not at work I'll try to resubmit this issue.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
